turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Servo (radio control).
turn.1: What is the difference between PWM and servo?
turn.2: The two types are both PWM because the servo responds to the width of the pulse.
turn.3: what is the order of operations?
turn.4: However, in the first case a servo may also be sensitive to pulse order.
turn.6: The servo is controlled by three wires: ground, power, and control.
turn.7: what is the function of the third wire?
turn.8: The servo will move based on the pulses sent over the control wire, which set the angle of the actuator arm.
turn.9: how fast does the servo respond?
turn.10: The servo expects a pulse every 20 ms in order to gain correct information about the angle.
turn.11: what is the range of motion?
turn.12: The width of the servo pulse dictates the range of the servo's angular motion.
